solution.text:
Total surface area of all the cubes \(= 5 \times 6 \times 1.4^2 = 58.8 cm^2\)
Area of each face =\(1.4^2 cm^2 = 1.96 cm^2\)
Number of faces that face inward = 10 faces
Therefore, outer surface area = 58.8 - 19.6 = 39.2 \(cm^2\)
Cost of paint = Rs 20 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the object = \(39.2 \times 20\)
= Rs. 784

content.text: Five cubes of edge 1.4 cm each are placed side by side and stuck together as shown. The cost of painting is Rs 20 per \(cm^2\). What is the cost of painting the outer surface of the entire object?

hint.text: Count the number of faces that are outward facing

content.text: The dimensions of a cuboid are in the ratio of 6:5:2 (l:b:h). If the total surface area is 104 \(m^2\). What is the length of the cuboid?
What is the Breadth of the cuboid?

solution.text:
Let length:breadth:height = 6x:5x:2x
Therefore, Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2(6 \times 5x^2 + 5 \times 2x^2 + 2 \times 6x^2)\)
= \(2(52)x^2\)
= \(104x^2\)
Given that surface area is \(104 m^2\)
Therefore, \(104 m^2 = 104 x^2\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2 = \frac{104}{104}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \sqrt{1}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) x = 1 metres

content.text: What is the Height of the cuboid?

hint.text: Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2 (lb + bh + lh)\)

solution.text: Surface Area of a cube = \(6 \times length^2 = 600 cm^2\)

solution.text: Surface Area of a cylinder = \(2 \times \pi \times r \times(r + h) = 6545 cm^2\)

content.text: In the cylinder below, diameter=49 cm, h=18 cm, find its surface area

solution.text:
Surface Area = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims
\(= 2\pi {r_ o}h + 2\pi {r_ i}h + 2\pi ({r_ o}^2 - {r_ i}^2)\)
\(= 3520 + 3080 + 377.14 = 6977.14 cm^2\)

solution.text:
Area of tin sheet required for 1 box = Surface area of one box
\(= 2 (5 \times 9 + 9 \times 5 + 5 \times 5) = 230 cm^2\)
Therefore, area of tin required for 5 boxes \(= 230 \times 5\)
\(= 1150 cm^2\)

content.text: You need to create a tin box of dimensions \(5 cm \times 9 cm \times 5 cm.\) What is the area of a sheet of tin required to make 5 such tins?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area of the box

solution.text:
Curved Surface area of the roller \(= 2 \pi rh = 2\pi \times \frac {7}2 \times 11 = 242 cm^2\)
Area covered per rotation \(= 242 cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area painted in 58 rolls \(= 242 \times 58 = 14036 cm^2\)

content.text: Last Monday, Ram painted a rectangular wall with a cylindrical paint roller. The length of the roller is 11 cm and its diameter is 7 cm. While painting, the roller rolled over 58 times completely. What surface area did Ram paint?

hint.text: How much area does the roller cover in one rotation?

solution.text:
Total surface area \(= 3750= 6 (side)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Length of side = \( \left(\sqrt {\frac {3750}{6}} \right) = 25 cm\)

content.text: A closed box in the shape of a cube has a total outer surface area of 3750 \(cm^2.\) What is the length of its side in centimetres?

hint.text: Remember that surface area of a cube is \(6 \times side^2\)

solution.text:
The surface area of the box \(= 2 (27 \times 24 + 24 \times 12 + 27 \times 12) = 2520 cm^2\)
Cost of painting the box = Rs. 1.4 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the box = \(2520 \times 1.4\)
= Rs. 3528
